question: I am something you can break without touching. What am I?
The more you take from me, the bigger I get. What am I?
I fly without wings, I cry without eyes. What am I?
I have keys but open no locks. What am I?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don’t have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
I start tall but shrink with time; you use me to mark special days. What am I?
I go up but never come down. What am I?
I have a face, but no eyes; hands, but no fingers. What am I?
I go in hard, come out soft, and people love to chew me. What am I?
I can be cracked, made, told, and played. What am I?
I am invisible, but you can feel me. I can knock things down but have no hands. What am I?
I hold water but have holes. What am I?
I can be tall, short, thick, or thin, and I’m made of wood or lead. What am I?
I can be found in your mouth, yet I never speak. What am I?
I help you see the world but need to be cleaned often. What am I?
You can find me in the sky but I am not alive. I can be full or new. What am I?
I get sharper the more you use me. What am I?
I have a trunk but never forget. What am I?
I make people smile when I show up at the right moment. What am I?
I have a mane but am not a horse; I am the king of my land. What am I?
I am home to books, but I am not a house. What am I?
I have numbers but am not alive; people check me often. What am I?
I can travel around the world while staying in the same place. What am I?
I am full of stars, planets, and mysteries. What am I?
I can be shattered but never bleed. What am I?
I exist to be filled, but the more I am used, the smaller I get. What am I?
I am sweet and golden, and I come from bees. What am I?
I am round, bouncy, and used in sports. What am I?
I can be bitten, yet I am not food. What am I?
